description: This unit presents students with in-depth knowledge about a range of contemporary cognitive behavioural therapies including cognitive therapy, rational emotive behaviour therapy, behavioural therapy, narrative therapy, acceptance and commitment therapy, reality therapy, dialectic behaviour therapy and solution-focused therapy. Throughout the unit students draw on their current or previous clinical professional experience as they develop understandings of these models and their view of the individual and his/her symptoms. The strengths and limitations of each counselling approach are critically examined. The role of the counsellor within each therapeutic approach is contrasted and analysed.
